item.title: Making a font of my handwriting · Chameth.com
item.description: Recently I’ve been on a small campaign to try to make my personal website more… personal. Little ways to make it obvious it’s mine and personal, not just another piece of the boring corporate dystopia that is most of the web these days. I don’t quite want to fully regress to the Geocities era and fill the screen with animated under construction GIFs, but I do want to capture some of that vibe.

item.title: Logic and creativity
item.description: Recently I filled in a survey about the shape I see the the year as when imagining it. This is a topic I find interesting since my own experience when asking people this question is that it never fails to give interesting answers and usually an interesting discussion afterwards. I therefore took care to give detailed answers, and filled out the various other questions of the survey as well as I could. The final question, “Do you consider yourself more logically or creatively thinking?”, made me sigh, however.

item.title: Expose Offline LLM via RESTful API
item.description:
Want to make your own offline Large Language Model (LLM) available through an API endpoint? In this video, I’ll walk you step-by-step through creating an ASP.NET Core Web API that serves responses from your locally hosted LLM—no cloud required.
You’ll learn:
How to integrate an offline LLM (GGUF format) into your ASP.NET Core project How to design an API endpoint to interact with your model How to build a client that sends prompts and streams responses
This approach gives you: ✅ Full data privacy – nothing leaves your server ✅ Cost control – no monthly API bills ✅ Freedom & flexibility – choose and switch models anytime
Whether you’re building a personal AI assistant, integrating into internal tools, or creating a secure enterprise AI service, this tutorial will help you take control of your AI infrastructure.
📂 Source code here: https://github.com/hassanhabib/LLM.Offline.API.Streaming
#OfflineLLM #ASPNETCore #LocalAI #SelfHostedAI #DotNet #GGUF #LlamaCpp
item.author: (Hassan Habib)

item.title: Offline LLM + MCP: Smart Tool Calling in Action
item.description:
Learn how to combine an offline LLM with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to build an AI that can discover tools dynamically and call the right one.
In this demo, I use Mistral 7B Instruct (GGUF) running locally to: Read the MCP function catalog in real time Choose the correct tool based on a user request Execute it—all offline
Perfect for: Privacy-first AI development Local & offline LLM setups Smart function calling without cloud dependencies
Here's the source code: https://github.com/hassanhabib/SimpleMcp.Demo
Tech stack: C# (.NET 9), Mistral 7B Instruct Q8_0, MCP, offline LLM.
item.author: (Hassan Habib)
